name: Cattail Canyon (East Fork)
description:
Introduction

A branch of Cattail Canyon that skips the first batch of rappels including the tallest one but has a 350 footer of its own.

Approach

Park at the Chisos Basin. Hike to Laguna West campsite and drop in at 29.248781°, -103.319528°.

Descent

R1: 350' off of two bolts is located at the coordinates shown on the map (banner photo).

Following this rappel, you shortly intersect the main Cattail Canyon drainage a quarter mile downstream from the 200' pour-off after Bryan's Falls.

The remaining three rappels are Class B with some short swims mixed in and then two large waterfalls right at the end.

Exit

Follow the Cattail Falls trail 3 miles to the parking lot. To return to the Chisos Basin, either use a shuttle vehicle or hike the Window Trail. For the April 2023 descent we used the latter option and were 12 hours car-to-car.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

Explored by jcsjcs and team in April 2023, but the bolted anchor at R1 appeared to have been there for quite some time.
